reason: The mintToken function has an integer overflow that allows the owner to set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value.
The mintToken function has a logic error where the balance of the owner is subtracted from the total supply of the token, instead of adding the minted amount to the total supply.

The mintToken function uses the random.seed function, which generates random numbers based on the block timestamp. Since the block timestamp is always increasing, the random number will always be different, leading to potential issues with the balance of the owner.
The mintToken function requires the owner to have permission to set the balance of an arbitrary user, which allows unauthorized access to the balance of other users.
The mintToken function has a typo in the symbol name, where 'mintToken' is spelled with an 'i' instead of an 'e' in the lower case of the name.
